metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1682 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The API in Zabbix before 1.8.20rc1, 2.0.x before 2.0.11rc1, and 2.2.x before 2.2.2rc1 allows remote authenticated users to spoof arbitrary users via the user name in a user.login request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:2.2.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.2+dfsg-1').
